Replies.Reply: see from the number of cars in the parking lot that it's a company of about 50 - 75 employees.
You should come by tonight. Half price well drinks while the game's going.
Oh yeah. Well come by anyway.
Really? The wife out of town?
You guys having problems or something?
Why don't you do that in another bathroom. You've got three of 'em.
Yeah, but he probably lives in a crappy apartment.
Well, you have insurance for that kind of thing, right?
Yeah. And your balls are really important man. Your balls are everything. What kind of life would you have with no testicles? Can you imagine that shit?
Wait. Three months? I thought you said it was once a month.
Sorry.
Get some Xanax.

Yeah it is, but I find it's good for just about any phsychological problem. I mean, basically it just makes you feel good, so it sort of works for anything. I even take it when I have a cold. It's probably great for sexual frustration. Want me to get you some?
You know what else is good?
It's just good.
Hey man. What's goin' o-- Whoa!
Damn! Who's she? Is she new?
She's a tramp?
Damn, she's hot! Way to go.
Manpower, huh? Maybe I should give them a call. You don't usually have girls anywhere near that hot working here. What's the deal?
What?
No way! Really?
Hey, I'm sure she did. Are you kidding? You could have any girl down there.
Yeah, you're the Extract King man.
So how did she come on to you?
Yeah.
Really? How?
Wow. So, you gonna do anything about it?
Man, she is fine. You mind if I hit that then?
Okay.
What about that girl at work? She still into you?
I've got some Xanax if you want it.
Well maybe you should call that girl.
What about if Suzie cheated on you?
You wish she would cheat on you?
Yeah, it's a little weird. Sort of.
Do you think she would cheat on you?
You sure?
So you're saying she would probably cheat on you if she was put in temptation's way?
You know what you oughtta do?
No, no. Check this out -- If you really wish your wife would cheat on you, it's not that hard to make it happen.
Hire a gigolo to have an affair with your wife.
I'm serious. I know a guy.
Yeah.
This guy Brad. He comes in here all the time. He's a friend of Vic's. You could hire him to have an affair with Suzie.
Why not? You said you wouldn't care if she cheated on you. Then you'd be free to go out with that Cindy chick and get your ya-yas out -- with no guilt. Problem solved.
Man, what a great idea.
Damn. I don't think it was Xanax.
Yeah?
Oh nooo. Definitely not. What could be morally wrong about it?
Look, if she doesn't want to go for it, she doesn't have to. And if she does, then she's the one who sinned, and then it's perfectly morally right for you to go out and boff whoever you want.
Brad. You want me to give him a call?
Look, this is no big deal Joel.

Yeah. I mean, you can't lose. Just say you're hiring him to come clean the pool or something. See what happens. If she doesn't go for it, then at least you know you're doing the right thing by being faithful.
Well yeah, but don't forget, I'm getting ten percent.

I don't think they're called "pimps" when it's with male prostitutes, okay. There's some other word for it -- it's not a "john," but it's something like that. Besides, I'm the one who hooked all this up. And don't worry 'cuz it's coming out of Brad's money anyway.
Two-hundred and twenty.
Referrals.
Networking.
Okay, you've said that a few times now Brad. Go on to your car.
Goodnight Brad.
Let me drive you home. You're in no condition to drive.
Oh no. He does it all the time.
Yeah well, what do you excpect?
Oh, hey Joel.
Ah, yeah. As far as I know.
Yeah, but I got his number from Vic.
Vic doesn't have a phone right now.
Yeah, I thought it was weird too --
Sorry.
No shit? What was he doing?
Really? How much?
You know what you need to do?
Look, I know I joke around a lot, but this time I'm serious.
You should try smoking a little pot. It's just an herb, it heals.
Not when you just smoke a little.
I've been reading about it --
Come on Joel. Don't worry, this stuff isn't that strong.
Huh?
Hey Joel, why don't you call that chick now?
It's twelve thirty. She might be back by now.
Alright. At least you know she's home.
Well, it looks like you guys got a lot to talk about here so I think I'm just gonna go ahead and take off. Later guys.
Hey man. Sorry I bailed on you like that last night. It's just that I don't like to get involved in other people's personal shit, you know what I mean?
I didn't even know Willie had a girlfriend. She must be new. Man, Willie looked pissed.
Whoa, really?
Wow. Man, that really goes to show you -- this town is smaller than you think. You really gotta be careful.
You always give me free drinks though.
If I don't get home before about 8:00, she puts on the sweatpants and once the sweatpants are on, it's over -- I get nothing.
Shit. I'm gonna have to call you back.
All right. Now, what's the problem?
Okay! Okay, everyone settle down.
And Step, if you wanna be Floor Manager, this is the kind of thing you're going to have to deal with.
Okay, now Step, Rory, Hector, let's get this cleaned up, and get rolling again. We can't afford to fall behind today.
Shit!
Yeah, actually Nathan, I'm kind of in a hurry here.
I should go right now actually. I gotta call the office before they leave.
Actually we're going to be out of town that weekend.
Well, we wouldn't know anybody there. She get's kind of uncomfortable.
Um, why don't we talk about this later.
I gotta make this call before they leave.
Ah, look Nathan, I really gotta get inside and make this call. Let's talk about this another time.
Ah, just sort of a vacation. Look, I gotta run.
Man, that Nathan won't shut up.
What?
It's not the middle of the week.
What?!
I gotta get a house with a bathroom that's doesn't share a wall with the TV.
But what do I have really? It's a big pain in the ass.
I'm always working; can't stop or the whole place will fall apart.
Hell, I'd move into a crappy apartment if the bathroom wasn't right next to the TV.
I thought you said he wasn't serious; he was just sniffing around.
You're kidding.
Tell 'em hell yes.
Well, he's definitely lost one of 'em. They think they might be able to re-attach the other one, but they're not sure.
Oh yeah. Of course. In fact, he'll probably get a huge settlement.
Boy it really makes you stop and think about how fragile we are --
You know Dean, my life wouldn't be much different than it is now actually.
Actually, it sucks.
What?
Xanax? Isn't that for anxiety?
No.
For what?
Are you on something now?
Yeah, sure. How is Step?          22.
Brian, you call everyone here "Dinkus." I don't know who you're talking about.
Yeah. She's a temp.
No a temp. Quit staring.
Hey, I didn't hire her. She came here through Manpower, like everybody else. They just sent her over.
Yeah, I know. I guess it makes sense though if you think about it.
You wanna hear something really weird?
She came on to me.
I don't know about that.
Well, first she started asking me about what happened to Step and all that stuff -- you know, just sort of making conversation?
But it really seemed like she was flirting with me, you know?
Well, you see that guy down there by the fork lift?
His band is playing somewhere, at some party this weekend, and she asked me if I wanted to go with her.
Now wait a second. Calm down Mary.
Well, what did it look like.
I'm sick of it Dean. I'm sick of being turned down in my own house by my own wife. We're turning into one of those brother-sister couples.
No we don't!
No, I can't. I can't cheat on Suzie. I just gotta power through it until I'm so old that I can't get it up anymore.
I wish she would.
No. I don't think it would actually.
I guess that's weird huh?
But see, then I could do something about all this sexual frustration, without feeling guilty about it.
Yeah, maybe.
I don't wanna do any drugs Dean.
How?
What?
You know a gigolo?
How do you know a gigolo?
Come on Dean.
You know, maybe I will try some of that Xanax.
Huh?
Ah, who cares?
You know that thing you were talking about? About the gigolo?
Do you think it would be wrong to do that? I mean morally wrong?
Yeah, I guess you're right. I can't think of anything morally wrong about it either.
And this guy, he's a friend of yours? What's his name?
I don't know. It's kinda weird even talking about it.
Really?
Alright. What the hell.
So it's two-hundred dollars then?
What, so you're a pimp now?
Alright, alright.
So it's two-hundred dollars then?
Wait a minute--
Yeah?
No no no. God no! It's not like that. I won't even be there. I'll be at work. Remember? We already talked about this.
What you'll do, is come to my house pretending to be the new pool cleaner. Then you simply try to seduce my wife. Okay? If she doesn't respond, you simply clean the pool and leave. That's all.
Yeah, that's right.
Remember, she might not go for it--
Are you sure about this guy Dean?
I don't know. He sure doesn't seem too bright.
Oh shit!
Dean?
Shit! What was I thinking?! We gotta call it off. Right now. Can you call that guy, Brad?
Tell him I'll pay him anyway, whatever, just don't come over.
What? I thought you called him last night.
Well get it from him again.
Shit! I'll try information.
Mexican?! The guy's got blonde hair and blue eyes!
Shit!
Not now Brian.
Not now!
I can't, I--
Who?
Hello?
Yes.
What do you mean?
You weren't even supposed to be there for another 45 minutes.
Easy? What do you mean "easy"?
No. Tell me. Tell me how it happened.
I wanna hear everything.
Yeah.
Okay that's enough! Stop!
I don't need to hear anymore.
NO! No. Look, I gotta go. Bye.
Holy shit.
Dammit !
Oh, I'm kind of busy actually.
Look, ah, we can't go. Remember?
Yeah, but remember, I told you we didn't really want to go to this thing.
Look, I gotta get going.
It sucks.
Nothing.
I don't feel well. I'm going to bed.
I think Step is just chest-beating.
Oh, hey Cindy. You can just call me Joel.
Yeah, I think I'll probably go.
Hi. I can't talk right now--
The new pool cleaner. You saw him yesterday right? Not today.
What'd he look like?
You sure it was today? Not yesterday?
You're absolutely sure?
What the hell were you doing at my house today?!
Bullshit!
I can't believe my wife slept with that guy.

No, you're right. He may be a stupid, dull-witted moron, but he can get any girl he wants. Me, I had to work for it. I had to work hard, get a career going, take Suzie out a bunch of times, marry her. But not Brad. He gets to waltz into my house and have sex with my wife just like that. Oh, and by the way? That little prick was at my house again today.
Take a wild guess.
I'm not going to let him do it for free. No way. I'm paying him.
Oh, I don't know. The same, I guess. Why?
I don't wanna do drugs Dean.
I get paranoid when I smoke pot.
Oh, wonderful.
Ah, what the hell.
What?
Oh, I thought somebody said something.
What time is it?
Alright.
It's busy.
Yeah.
No. I'll be fine. I just want to sleep right now, okay?
Don't worry about it! People get their asses kicked all the time!
He isn't returning my calls.
Oh, I fell down some stairs.
No he--!
What? Where did you hear that?
What?!
Really?
Fire Hector? What for?
No. Don't fire him. Just trust me on this. Give him another week.
Okay, thanks.
I better get this.
Hello.
Uh-huh.
He did take a swing at me Dean.
Yes.
I'm not feeling well. I'm going to go home early.
Shit!
What the hell were you doing on my street again?!
What the hell is wrong with you anyway? Do you do this with all your clients -- just keep coming back and hanging around?
What?! I thought you were a professional!
In love?!
HA! Man are you stupid. You are so goddamn dumb. You think she loves you? You're nothing but a piece of ass to her. That's all.
Oh, you don't think so "dude?"
How about I go home right now and tell her? Tell her you did it for the money. How about that loverboy?
You don't think so? Watch me.
Don't mess it up?! You're talking about my wife! My house! Stupid-
Hi.
So how was that new pool cleaner?
I think he did a horrible job. I don't think we should use him anymore.
Okay.
No.
.so some of the guys at work are saying you gave Cindy that black eye.
Yeah, I know it's not.
You sure about that?
You know she lives with this guy Willie right?
You sure about that?
Huh?
What!!!?
We don't have this much money! Not even close!
Replies.Didascalie: (so pissed he can barely get the words out)

Replies.Reply: What the ff-- Are you shitting me!? That would bankrupt us!
If you think I'm just going to give up this entire company that I built from the ground up--
It was an accident!
I don't wanna slam my testicles in the door! I want you to be reasonable! You won't even budge one penny! Come on!
I'll slam your balls in the door!
I don't need this. I'm going home.
You know what? Fine. Fine.
You banged the pool cleaner.
That's what you're trying to tell me right? You had sex with Brad?
Yes I knew. I hired him.
I don't mean I hired him to clean the pool, I mean I hired him to have sex with you.
He's a gigolo Suzie.
I hired him to have an affair with you so that I could have an affair without feeling guilty. I was really drunk and on some kind of horse tranquilizer and--
FIFTEEN TIMES?! Jesus Christ Suzie!
I only paid him once -- well, twice. The rest was on the house.
Yes. But I didn't.
Oh, I'm the asshole?
How could I? How could you?!!!

Okay. I'll admit, I made a big mistake. I was drunk, on drugs, stressed, sexually frustrated and I shouldn't have hired a male prostitute to seduce you. But if you had simply been faithful, none of this would've happened.
What do you see in Brad anyway?
No. You're not leaving me. I'm leaving you!
I couldn't kick your ass if I wanted to. You're a good 10 years younger than me, and I'm a pussy.
Why'd you have to get hung up on Suzie? You could have any girl you want.
You had her fifteen times.
Brad, you had sex with my wife.
Nothing.
Hi.
Ah, actually, I'm staying here too.
No thanks.
Right there. That's Mary's purse.
That's Mary's purse. You stole it, didn't you?
I've never seen another one. You probably have Sylvia's wallet in here somewhere too, don't you? And everything else that's been stolen from my employees.
No, I'm not. That's Mary's purse Goddammit! Okay? Everyone blamed Hector. He almost got fired.
Hector! Hard working guy, never did anything wrong. And what are you doing with Step? You're trying to screw him out of his settlement money aren't you?
Yes you do! You're the only reason he's suing us aren't you? You know how much work it took for me to build up that company? You just don't care about anybody do you?
You can't even admit that you stole this purse can you? You just can't do it.
I bet Cindy's not even your real name is it? Who are you? Where the hell are you from?

You can't answer can you? Because if you said one true thing, you'd have to tell the truth about something else and then it would all unravel wouldn't it? Then you'd have to admit that you stole this purse and God knows what else.
Well, I'm leaving now.
And I'm taking this purse with me.
What?
How do I know that?
I really hope you're not faking this right now, because I'm feeling really bad. Are you faking it?
Cindy?
Oh shit!
Here you go Mary.
And by the way, Hector didn't take it. Cindy did.
Really? Bring him in.
Yeah, he sure is.
You don't have to bankrupt the company.
I guess what I'm saying is, too much free time might not be such a good thing -- like that old saying, idle hands are the Devil's playground?
that is, if you dropped the lawsuit. -- and remember, you'll still get that insurance money --
What's that?
Deal.
Hold the line!
Okay, listen up everybody.
And I'm making Step the new Floor Manager.
It's about the journey Brian. The journey.
I heard you were right there when it happened. That must've been rough.
Maybe we should've been married in a Church like that one. Instead of the Botanical Gardens.
I mean otherwise.
Alright.
You get this job through Manpower?
I started here with Manpower too.
I'm the best sorter in here.
What are you doing?!
That's what I was tryin' to say.
Exactly.
You can go ahead of me if that's all you have.
Really? I work there too. Or, ah, I used to.
I just believe that what's right is right.
A message?
You think?
Joe Adler?
You did that for me?
No he didn't.
Wow, I don't think you've ever been to my house before. Have you?
This is my half brother Phil.
Sure, let's go out back.
You know, my lawyer told me not to talk to you.
You're not here to try to talk me out of suing are you?
Yes sir. She's my girlfriend. We might even get married after all this lawsuit-settlement stuff gets worked out.
What? That ain't true at all.
She got it from falling down some stairs.
What do you mean?
Oh no. No, she didn't even know about that 'til after we started going out.
Oh yeah. I didn't tell her about it for a while 'cuz I was kind of embarrassed, you know? You don't tell a girl you just met that you lost one of your balls. Especially a girl as hot as Cindy.
That's her ex. She broke up with him. She's gonna move out. She just needs to get all her stuff outta there.
Oh yeah. She's moving in with me.
Look, I know Cindy's got some problems, but she means well.
Oh. Well I'm not worried about that.
Hey.
The truth is, I just want to have my old life back -- I just want to go back to work. I'm a workin' man; that's what I do.
I just lay around and watch TV all day.
The problem is, if I bankrupt the company, there won't be a job to go back to.
Yeah, but then if I drop the lawsuit, you'll sell the company, and the new company might not hire me.
I'm sorry, I don't do much book readin'.
Really?
You make me floor manager.
Quit yapping and get back to work or you're fired.
Yeah.
My band's playing this Friday, come check us out.
is more melodic stuff.
So you comin' Friday?
Cool.
.And when they sell the company, Joel and Brian are gonna be the one's who get rich, and--
It's bullshit man. We should get a piece of it. I work my ass off.
That's right man. We should do it.
I heard those guys up there are the guys from General Mills.
We gotta act fast. They could be about to close the deal.
Yeah, then it's too late. If they've already sold it we can't get a piece of it. We gotta act fast. We need to do one of those walk outs.
I'm just gonna sit here.
I'm not gonna hold the line. If they're not gonna do their job, why should I do mine.
What are YOU doing?!
What is he doing?
You see that? We always get the blame.
I already warned him. This is the last time. I'm just gonna sit here.
I knew it. That's what happens when you don't pay attention.
My purse is stolen! It's gone!
He did it! He stole my purse!
I won't hold on! I'll call the cops!
It's gone! That's how.
See, there he goes again, slowing us down.
I can't believe he's still working here. You know Silvia can't find her wallet. Thinks it was stolen.
You know, I could get a job at Southwest Airlines. My Niece works there. I'd get better benefits than we get here too.
That's right.
And we're the ones doing all the work.
Gabrielle and I work harder than anybody. I should be making what Brian makes. If you add up all the crates I move, I lift 10,000 pounds a day. Minimum.
If we quit, this place couldn't run. They wouldn't be able to sell this place for anything.
That's right. I could get a job at Gemco like that. At Gemco, all the employees are owners -- even says so on the name tags.
Joel hasn't been in all morning.
Can you believe that? Blaming Cindy just to protect Hector.
You know, if Joel's going to put him in charge, we should go on strike. You know, at Gemco, the union handles the strikes and you don't even have to--
And then Joel's gonna come yell at us, cuz he's not doing his job.
You're not gonna shut it off?
She's so nice too.
Tell me about it. Sorry I missed the drama; I was showing boy-genius down there how to back up a forklift.
That's his whole career, driving that damn forklift. You'd think he'd wanna learn how.
No, the other one -- what's-her-
You're not gonna believe this.
Yeah, well he's serious now. He just made an offer -- I mean a real offer this time.
No. It must be part of some bigger strategic move, because it's over market value I think.
I mean, yeah, there's a lot of details to work out, but this could be great. They'll be calling back next week, what should I tell them?
So obviously Step's not coming back anytime soon. I had to hire a couple temps. Is that okay?
Better. They say he's going home in a couple of days. Speaking of which, the guys at General Mills heard about this whole Step thing.

Well yeah. Don't you? I mean, think about it. Imagine if you asked a bunch of jurors how much you'd have to pay 'em to cut their balls off? I mean, I wouldn't let someone cut my balls off for a billion dollars. Seriously --
"don't want somethin' fer nothin "' and "What's right is right." If we can just get him to sign something to that effect we should be fine.
Yeah, well I think when you lose your balls it mellows you out. You don't get as pissed off and aggressive about things. I know it's true for horses, and bulls.
Dinkus. Can you believe that?
Yeah, well boy-genius asked for a raise. I said, "are you kidding?
Well, I was thinking about that, but hey, if this deal goes through next week, I won't have to. It's not like I'm gonna be inviting Dinkus and Boy-Genius over for dinner.
Now hold on--
Joel, we gotta talk.
Ah yeah, it's kind of important --
You got a second? I think we might have a big problem here. I'm not sure what happened, but all of the sudden Step says he doesn't want to settle anymore. I think he might've talked to a lawyer.
Like I say, General Mills isn't going to make their offer official until this settles.
Oh man, what happened to you?
Man, everyone's getting hurt.
Step did it. Can you believe that?
That's what she told Mary.
Apparently they've been going out.
I know, it's weird. They didn't even meet here. They met at a grocery store or something. Just a total coincidence.
Anyway, we're gonna have to hire a couple of new people because  CINDY'S QUITTING--
Yep. And if it's okay with you, I'd like to go ahead and fire Hector.
You know, Mary's purse? Sylvia's wallet? It's gotta be him. Who else could it be?
Alright. If you say so.
Man, are you okay? Have you seen a doctor?
The meeting with Step's lawyer. Or lawyers I should say. It's today remember?
Look, we need to cool off a minute.
We're screwed. General Mills has pretty much withdrawn the offer pending a really favorable settlement with Step.
Not only do we not sell the company, we could wind up bankrupt.
Excuse me?
Step's here to see you.
No, he's outside. At the loading dock. Wants to talk to you alone back there for some reason.
"Man to man."
Huh? You're not selling?
How've ya been? I left you a message last week. I don't know if you got it or not.
Oh yeah? You been busy?
Well, real quick while I got ya here -- what're you guys doing November 17th?
Oh yeah? Where you going?
Oh, wait a minute -- I'm sorry, I meant the 7th. Yeah, November 7th.

Great. There's this dinner Leslie and I are going to. It's an annual thing -- we do it every year with the Rotary Club -- it's for charity. It's just a whole lot of fun, and we wanted to invite you and Suzie to be our guests at our table. It's--
Really? Why not? It's a lot of fun.
Why not?
Oh no -- It's not like that. She won't be uncomfortable. I guarantee it. No, it's not like that at all. It's not formal or anything. Trust me. It's just a real loose bunch.
I tell you what. Why don't we do this -- I'll go ahead and get tickets, since they're gonna sell out fast. You talk to Suzie. See what she says. Like I say, she won't be uncomfortable at all.
Sorry, I almost forgot -- the tickets are forty dollars a plate.
Oh, and if you need us to look out for the house or anything when you go out of town --
Well, just let us know. Where you guys going anyway?
Alright then. We'll see ya.
Oh, Joel one more thing--
How's it goin'?
No, this is the 7th. You said you're going out of town on the 17th.
But I already bought the tickets.
It's just a whole lot of fun. You guys'll have a great time.
Oh, one more thing --
Hi there. Almost missed ya.
Hey, I noticed you guys got a new pool cleaner today. How is he?
Huh?
No. It was today. The new guy.
Blonde haired kid, about this high, good looking. Real good looking.
Yeah.
Oh, hey guys. Glad I caught ya.
Oh, you guys goin' somewhere?
Well, you think I could go ahead and get that check from ya then?
When would be a good time, you think?
See the thing is--
Great, what time?
Hello?
Why are you cleaning the pool yourself? That new guy didn't work out?
Boy, you just can't get good help, eh?
So, did you get a chance to write that check?
Well gee, I wish you would've told me that before I went and bought the tickets.
Well, it sure sounded like you guys were going. Leslie was gonna talk to you about it, but you didn't return our calls. I mean, I already bought these tickets.
Well, I just--
Yeah, what an asshole. I don't even go into the front yard anymore. That wife of his is even worse.
Monday?
Oh shit!
Idol!
Sorry honey. Maybe this weekend.
Thanks.
No. It's ours.
Oh, thanks.
Really? What's wrong?
Oh my God Joel, are you alright?
What? By who? What happened?
Let me drive you to the hospital.
Oh hi. You're home early.
Well yeah, I guess he didn't do a very good job.
Okay.
Are you all right, Joel? You want an aspirin or anything?
No Brad, we can't. I'm sorry, but we have to stop doing this.
It's not right. I feel horrible.
Ah, yes it does.
Because of all the things I just said.
Do you need me to say them again?
No.
No. Look, you gotta go Brad. Joel could be home any second.
Okay. Okay, just go and we'll talk later.
Replies.Didascalie: (just trying to get rid of  HIM)

Replies.Reply: God, what a moron.
Listen Joel, there's something I have to tell you. I think we need to be honest with each other.
I'm not sure how to say this, but --
You knew?
Well I know you hired him, but how did you know about--
What?
So you've been paying Brad this whole time? All fifteen times?!
You wanted to have an affair with another woman?
You asshole.
Yes! How could you?
None of this would've happened if you hadn't hired him.
You're sick, you know that?
That's it. I'm leaving.
Fine.
Now's not a good time Nathan.
No. Look, we can't talk right now.
Now's not a good time.
I don't know.
Okay tomorrow.
I don't know. Just come by tomorrow. I can't talk now.
Yeah, didn't work out.
Yeah.
Look Nathan, Joel and I aren't going to that dinner okay?
Joel never agreed to this Nathan, and neither did I.
Okay, let me be really clear with you then. When we say "I don't think so," or even "I'm not sure,"
Shut up! In fact, let me be even more clear with you. We don't like you! Is that clear enough? You're dull, you never shut up, you never listen, and we don't want anything to do with you ever again!
Nathan?
Yeah, I'm okay.
.I just lost it. I started yelling at him. I said horrible things. He had an aneurism and I probably caused it.
I think the last thing I said to him was "shut up." Those were the last words he heard.
It could happen to any of us Joel.
